thread.title: Korean actors star in films with Hollywood stars
thread.title_full: Korean actors star in films with Hollywood stars | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Jonathan M. Hicap
title: Korean actors star in films with Hollywood stars
text:
by Jonathan M. Hicap
October 25, 2015 Lee Bum Soo and Lee Jung-jae (Photos from www.newsen.com)
Lee Jung-jae and Lee Bum Soo will star opposite Liam Neeson, who will play the role of American General Douglas MacArthur in the Korean film “Operation Chromite.”
The Korean movie is budgeted at 15 billion won (P616.57 million) and will revolve around the Battle of Incheon, which was given the code name Operation Chromite, according to the Korean Film Council.
MacArthur led the operation in September 1950 that led to the victory of the United Nations forces against North Korean troops.
Lee Jun Ki and Milla Jovovich (Instagram)
Production house Taewon Entertainment said the movie will tell the story of eight heroic Korean troop member who carried out an operation before the Incheon landing.
Lee Jung-jae will play a South Korean navy lieutenant while Lee Bum Soo will essay the role of an elite Soviet-trained North Korean officer.
“Operation Chromite” will be directed by John Lee, whose credits include “A Moment To Remember” and “71-Into The Fire.”
Neeson’s credits include “Schindler’s List,” “Star Wars” and “Les Miserables.”
Meanwhile, Korean actor Lee Jun Ki is part of the cast of the Hollywood film “Resident Evil: The Final Chapter.”
Hollywood actress Milla Jovovich posted a photo of her and Lee Jun Ki on the set of the film in Cape Town, South Africa.
“Working for the last few nights with the incredible 3rd Dan Tae Kwon Do master and actor Joon Gi has been insanely fun and so inspiring. Makes me want to go back to class and brush up on my martial arts skills!” she wrote on Instagram.
“Resident Evil: The Final Chapter” is the sixth and final installment in the series.
Lee Jun Ki’s Korean film credits include “The King And The Clown” and “Virgin Snow” and he also starred in Korean dramas such as “The 101st Proposal, “Iljimae” and “Arang And The Magistrate.”
